text:
“Taza chooses to stand back up, shows you the confidence he has in his wrestling” 

Or, perhaps, this type of tactical error is what has caused him to fall short. He was taken down a couple of times fairly easily in this same match already before this and shooting for a single is what caused him to lose. It wasn’t confidence I was just a bad decision
Oliver Taza and Keith Krikorian cut from that same cloth 😢
Who thought the mood lighting was a good idea.
So creative
Tackett essentially hitting a flying k guard entry is insane
Khan Tackett
Based on Jake Watson comments, he never actually watched the Dalpra x Taza match. Taza got man handled in that match
Unfortunate for Taza he’s an awesome competitor, that weight class is stacked he competes in.
Tackett is such a beast, incredible gas tank and drive to compete. Always hunting for that back take relentlessly!
4:58, when they reset, the bottom guys right hand was on outside. Before the reset, he had it on inside of bicep in a little better spot. Just Something I noticed.

taza is clearly at the same level as all these guys, having placed second or third at 4 trials in 7 months, but definitely has problems producing when it matters most. Seems as though some sport psychology mental training could help (maybe he's already training the mental, idk) , but his prof John Danaher thinks sport psychology is pointless
If this is the level of juijitsu.. terrible.. this is so bad, those guys suck!
Tarza might as well join B team at this point since he did 4 trials and always comes second lol.
Taza always the bridesmaid never the bride
Where are my guy Mike Perez’s videos!?!? Come on FLO!!!
The Tacketts and their Granby’s are just fascinating
nice to have commentators, I wouldn't know what's happening with the mats and screen background almost entirely black.
Invite Taza already man dang
Would love to see the Tackett brothers against the Ruotolo’s. These dudes are the most entertaining grapplers to watch at the moment, always engaging.
Man Oliver sure has been having a bad time lately, definitely a junior now
